top_categories.workout_context: Alentejo Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Alentejo Gravel’s alentejo rolling, portuguese gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Alentejo Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Alentejo Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
At 80 miles, Alentejo Gravel punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Alentejo Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Alentejo Gravel’s alentejo rolling gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Alentejo Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Alentejo Gravel — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Alentejo Gravel’s alentejo rolling gravel delivers on race day.
The varied gradients at Alentejo Gravel reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Alentejo Gravel — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on alentejo rolling gravel.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Alentejo Gravel’s 80 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Alentejo Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on alentejo rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: alentejo rolling, portuguese gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 80 miles of alentejo rolling gravel in Alentejo, Portugal.
